docs.lead_paragraph: After he jabbed himself with a needle last year on an Ebola ward in Sierra Leone, Dr. Lewis Rubinson became the first person to receive an experimental vaccine.

headline.main: A Mishap Sheds Light on an Ebola Vaccine
headline.print_headline: A Mishap Sheds Light on an Ebola Vaccine

docs.abstract: Dr Lewis Rubinson, who was given experimental Ebola vaccine after accidentally jabbing himself with needle in 2014 in Ebola ward in Sierra Leone, describes case in article and editorial published in JAMA; blood tests later found no evidence that he had ever been infected with Ebola.
docs.snippet: After he jabbed himself with a needle last year on an Ebola ward in Sierra Leone, Dr. Lewis Rubinson became the first person to receive an experimental vaccine.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Etsy Files for I.P.O.

docs.abstract: The online bazaar Etsy files its first I.P.O. prospectus. | AbbVie scoops up Pharmacyclics. | What to know about the bank stress tests. | Britain’s Serious Fraud Office is investigating the Bank of England.
docs.snippet: The online bazaar Etsy files its first I.P.O. prospectus. | AbbVie scoops up Pharmacyclics. | What to know about the bank stress tests. | Britain’s Serious Fraud Office is investigating the Bank of England.

docs.lead_paragraph: AbbVie announced that it has agreed to buy Pharmacyclics, a maker of a cancer drug that some analysts predict will eventually become one of the best-selling treatments.

headline.main: AbbVie to Pay $21 Billion for Pharmacyclics, Maker of a Promising Cancer Drug
headline.print_headline: AbbVie to Pay $21 Billion for Pharmacyclics, Maker of a Best-Selling Cancer Treatment

docs.abstract: AbbVie announces deal to buy Pharmacyclics for about $21 billion; Pharmacyclics makes cancer drug that may become one of best-selling treatments for the disease.
docs.snippet: AbbVie announced that it has agreed to buy Pharmacyclics, a maker of a cancer drug that some analysts predict will eventually become one of the best-selling treatments.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and ANDREW POLLACK

headline.main: Healthy in a Falling Apart Sort of Way
headline.print_headline: Healthy in a Falling Apart Sort of Way

docs.abstract: Older definitions of health, and the treatments they dictate, do not apply at a time when people function independently despite chronic ailments.
docs.snippet: Older definitions of health, and the treatments they dictate, do not apply at a time when people function independently despite chronic ailments.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a land where witchcraft is sought after more than science for curing illness, medicine men in Guinea say the Ebola epidemic would be over by now if they had been properly included in the outbreak response.

headline.main: Africa's Medicine Men Key to Halting Ebola Spread in Guinea
headline.print_headline: Africa's Medicine Men Key to Halting Ebola Spread in Guinea

docs.snippet: In a land where witchcraft is sought after more than science for curing illness, medicine men in Guinea say the Ebola epidemic would be over by now if they had been properly included in the outbreak response.
